fields.title: Service - Family - Strengthening Relationships
fields.content:
Families are deeply connected systems—when one person is affected, the whole dynamic shifts. At times, these connections bring closeness and support, but they can also lead to **misunderstandings, tension, or emotional distance.**  

Family sessions offer a space to **pause, reflect, and explore these dynamics together**, not to assign blame but to better understand how each person’s experiences, emotions, and interactions shape the family as a whole.

image.title: Wife looking at husband
image.description: Wife looking at her husband with their daughter blurred out in the background

fields.title: Service - Family - Understanding Family Patterns
fields.content:
Every family has **unspoken rules, roles, and expectations** that shape daily interactions. Some strengthen relationships, while others may contribute to **stress, recurring conflicts, or emotional disconnection.**  

### Common Family Dynamics We Explore  
- **Communication styles** – How family members express themselves and where misunderstandings arise.  
- **Family roles** – Longstanding roles and whether they still serve each person.  
- **Unspoken expectations** – Hidden assumptions shaping interactions and relationships.  

Seeing these patterns clearly helps families **shift unhelpful cycles** and find more supportive ways to relate to one another.

image.title: Family dinner - distracted
image.description: Festive dinner table with boy looking distracted and woman focussed on her food.

fields.title: Service - Family - Breaking Unhelpful Cycles
fields.content:
Many families feel stuck in patterns of **miscommunication, unresolved tension, or emotional distance.** Small disagreements may escalate quickly, certain family members may feel unheard, or past wounds may continue to affect present relationships.  

### Some Common Challenges We Work Through
- **Recurring conflicts** – Arguments that never seem to resolve.  
- **Parenting struggles** – Balancing guidance and connection.  
- **Generational patterns** – Unspoken family expectations passed down over time.  
- **Life transitions** – Adjusting to changes like divorce, blending families, or shifting family roles.  

Rather than focusing on **who is right or wrong**, therapy helps uncover **what keeps the cycle going** and how small shifts in communication and perspective can create lasting positive change.

image.title: Family silhouette
image.description: Black and white silhouette of a family holding hands

fields.title: Service - Family - Rebuilding Connection and Trust
fields.content:
Family sessions aren’t just about resolving conflict—it’s about strengthening the **connection, trust, and shared understanding** that help families thrive.  

### How We Work Together:  
- **Improving communication** – Creating space for honest, open conversations.  
- **Navigating conflict with awareness** – Moving from frustration to mutual understanding.  
- **Rebuilding emotional bonds** – Strengthening connection through recognition and validation.  

Every family is different—there’s no “right” way to be. Instead of rigid solutions, we explore **what works best for your family** so relationships feel more supportive, open, and fulfilling.

image.title: Family looking at sea
image.description: Black and white photo of a family holding hands standing barefoot on the sand looking at the sea.

fields.title: Service - Individual - A Space for Clarity and Growth
fields.header: A Space for Clarity and Growth
fields.content:
Life can feel overwhelming, leaving you stuck in patterns that no longer serve you. **Therapy isn’t about fixing you—it’s about helping you understand yourself more fully** and reconnecting with your strengths.  

### I create a space where you can 
- **Pause and reflect** without pressure or judgment.  
- **Understand patterns** in thoughts, emotions, and relationships.  
- **Gain clarity and choice** in how you move forward.  

You don’t have to figure everything out alone.

image.title: Water drops on a leaf
image.description: Water drops on a leaf

fields.title: Service - Individual - Understanding Your Story in Context
fields.content:
The way we experience challenges isn’t random—it’s shaped by our past, relationships, and cultural influences. **Systemic therapy helps you see the bigger picture.**  
### Instead of focusing on symptoms, we explore  
- **How past experiences shape your present reactions.**  
- **Why certain patterns repeat** and how to shift them.  
- **New ways to approach struggles** that align with who you are.  

This is not about dwelling on the past but **gaining awareness that gives you more choice in the present.**

image.title: River delta
image.description: Top down view of a river delta

fields.title: Service - Individual - Finding Clarity in Life’s Challenges
fields.content:
Whether you’re navigating anxiety, self-doubt, or a major transition, therapy provides a space to **step back and explore what’s really happening.**  

Some common themes we can explore together:  

### Emotional Well-being  
- **Managing anxiety and overthinking** – Feeling more present and grounded.  
- **Building confidence** – Understanding self-doubt and shifting toward self-acceptance.  

### Life Transitions  
- **Navigating change** – Career shifts, relationships, personal identity.  
- **Exploring personal identity** – Gaining clarity on what truly matters to you.  

Each session is **tailored to your unique experiences**—we follow what feels most important to you, at a pace that makes sense.

image.title: Climber mountain
image.description: Silhouette of a man climbing a mountain white the sun it setting

fields.title: Service - Individual - A Collaborative, Practical Approach
fields.content:
Therapy isn’t about becoming someone different—it’s about becoming more yourself. **Through systemic therapy, we explore not just what you want to change, but how that change can feel meaningful and lasting.**  

### Some of the ways we might work together
- **Recognizing patterns** – Bringing awareness to thoughts, emotions, and behaviours.  
- **Developing strategies** – Finding tools that actually fit your life.  
- **Strengthening resilience** – Navigating difficulties with greater clarity and confidence.  

There’s no single path to growth. **Together, we explore what works best for you.**

image.title: Hand reach out help
image.description: Blurred background of a woman with her hand reaching out to you

fields.title: Service - Couples - Strengthening Emotional Bonds
fields.content:
A fulfilling relationship isn’t just about resolving conflict—it’s about nurturing **connection, trust, and a shared sense of purpose.** Over time, responsibilities, stress, and unresolved tensions can create distance. Therapy provides an opportunity to **reconnect, reflect, and explore what strengthens your bond.**  

### Rebuilding and Deepening Connection  
Some of the ways we can strengthen your relationship include:  
- **Rekindling emotional intimacy** – Creating space for affection, appreciation, and shared joy.  
- **Building trust** – Understanding how to repair and rebuild after challenges.  
- **Aligning values and goals** – Exploring where your paths intersect and how to move forward together.  

Every relationship has its own rhythm. Therapy isn’t about fitting into an idealized version of what a relationship “should” be—it’s about **discovering what works best for you as a couple** and creating a partnership that feels fulfilling and supportive for both of you.

image.title: Couple holding hands
image.description: Couple holding hands

fields.title: Service - Couples - Navigating Conflict with Awareness
fields.content:
Disagreements are part of any relationship, but when **conflict feels repetitive or emotionally exhausting**, it can create distance instead of resolution. In therapy, we go beyond surface-level arguments to explore **what’s really happening beneath the conflict.**  

### Understanding Conflict Patterns  
Rather than focusing on who is “right” or “wrong,” we explore:  
- **Miscommunication and assumptions** – Learning to clarify intent before reacting.  
- **Recurring arguments** – Identifying patterns that keep conflicts unresolved.  
- **Emotional disconnection** – Addressing feelings of loneliness or disengagement.  
- **Differences in needs or expectations** – Exploring where each partner is coming from without judgment.  

Approaching conflict with **curiosity instead of criticism** allows couples to express themselves **honestly and respectfully,** fostering a greater sense of partnership.

image.title: Couple awareness
image.description: Couple on a couch, their heads only visible in the reflection of the glass table in front of them

fields.title: Service - Couples - Building Connection and Understanding
fields.content:
Communication and connection lie at the heart of every relationship. Over time, even strong couples can struggle to truly hear each other, leading to **misunderstandings, reactive conversations, and unspoken frustrations.**  

### I provide a space where both partners can  
- Communicate **with clarity and honesty** without fear of judgment.  
- Recognize the patterns shaping interactions.  
- Shift from **defensiveness to deeper understanding.**  

This isn’t about fixing a relationship overnight—it’s about developing **new ways of relating, built on openness, trust, and connection.**

image.title: Couple  silhouette
image.description: Silhouette or a couple holding hands with clouds on the left and clear sky on the right

fields.title: Service - Parents - Strengthening Parent-Child Connection
fields.content:
At the heart of parenting is **connection**—the trust and understanding that allow your child to feel seen, heard, and supported. This bond is built through **everyday interactions, communication, and the ability to navigate challenges together.**  

### How parental counselling Can Support You:  
- **Improving communication** – Strengthening trust and emotional security with your child.  
- **Setting boundaries with confidence and warmth** – Balancing guidance with respect for your child’s individuality.  
- **Creating a supportive family environment** – Ensuring that both parents and children feel valued and understood.  

Parenting is a continuous learning process. **By taking time to reflect on your own emotions, experiences, and patterns, you naturally strengthen your relationship with your child.**

fields.title: Service - Parents - Navigating Parenting Challenges
fields.content:
Each stage of parenting brings unique challenges, from early childhood to adolescence and beyond. Some moments feel overwhelming—whether it’s **tantrums, sibling conflicts, setting boundaries, or maintaining emotional balance.**  

### Common Challenges We Can Work Through
- **Managing parental stress** – Prioritizing self-care while caring for your child.  
- **Navigating differences in parenting styles** – Strengthening communication between co-parents.  
- **Supporting your child’s emotional needs** – Fostering security, resilience, and confidence.  
- **Breaking generational patterns** – Understanding inherited beliefs about parenting and redefining them in a way that feels right for you.  

This process isn’t about finding **one "right" way to parent**—it’s about **finding what works best for your family.**

fields.title: Service - Parents - Understanding Your Parenting Style
fields.content:
Each stage of parenting brings unique challenges, from early childhood to adolescence and beyond. Some moments feel overwhelming—whether it’s **tantrums, sibling conflicts, setting boundaries, or maintaining emotional balance.**  

### Common Challenges We Can Work Through
- **Managing parental stress** – Prioritizing self-care while caring for your child.  
- **Navigating differences in parenting styles** – Strengthening communication between co-parents.  
- **Supporting your child’s emotional needs** – Fostering security, resilience, and confidence.  
- **Breaking generational patterns** – Understanding inherited beliefs about parenting and redefining them in a way that feels right for you.  

This process isn’t about finding **one "right" way to parent**—it’s about **finding what works best for your family.**

fields.title: Service - Parents - Support for Your Parenting Journey
fields.content:
Parenting is one of life’s most meaningful roles, yet it comes with challenges, uncertainties, and moments of self-doubt. There is no **one-size-fits-all approach**, and at times, it’s natural to feel overwhelmed or in need of support.  

Parental counseling offers a space to **reflect, gain clarity, and develop a parenting approach that aligns with your values and family dynamics.**

fields.title: Blog - Exploring Patterns, Perspectives & Growth
fields.content:
Systemic therapy looks beyond individual struggles to explore the **patterns, relationships, and dynamics** that shape everyday life. These articles provide:  

- **New perspectives** on relationships, family, and personal growth.  
- **Practical tools** to navigate challenges with clarity.  
- **Reflections on systemic therapy** and its role in daily experiences.  

Whether you're looking for guidance or simply a fresh way to approach life’s complexities, these articles offer insight and support.

image.title: Reflection
image.description: Woman holding a piece of mirror reflecting her face.

fields.title: Accessibility and Confidentiality
fields.content:
Your privacy and comfort are important. All sessions are held in a **secure, confidential** online setting, ensuring you can speak openly and feel fully supported.  

I strive to make therapy as accessible as possible. If you have any specific concerns or accessibility needs, please let me know—I’m happy to discuss how we can accommodate them.

fields.title: Contact - Fees and practical information
fields.content:
Understanding the logistics of therapy can help you feel more comfortable about getting started.  

- **Session Length:** Typically 45 minutes  
- **Session Type:** Online video calls  
- **Payment Options:** Details provided upon booking  

If you have any questions about fees or practical arrangements, feel free to reach out—I’m happy to provide more information.

fields.title: Contact - What to expect when you reach out
fields.header: What to expect when you reach out
fields.content:
Reaching out for therapy can sometimes feel like a big step. Here’s what happens after you contact me:  

### **1. Free 15-Minute Intake**  
Our first conversation is a chance to get to know each other. You can share a bit about what brings you to therapy, ask any questions, and get a sense of how we might work together.  

### **2. Scheduling a Session**  
If we decide to move forward, we will schedule an online session at a time that works for you. Since all sessions take place online, you can **access therapy from anywhere** in a way that fits into your life.  

### **3. Preparing for Your First Session**  
In our first session, we will explore your needs, expectations, and hopes for therapy. There is no pressure to have everything figured out—this is simply a space to start the conversation.

fields.title: Contact - Contact Details
fields.content:
- **Email:** [eleni@mikrouli.nl](mailto:eleni@mikrouli.nl)  
- **Phone:** [00 31 6 19 44 62 63](tel:+31619446263)
- **Languages:** Greek, Dutch, English  
- **Sessions:** Online only  

If you’d like to schedule a session or have any questions, feel free to reach out by **email or phone.** I aim to respond as soon as possible to ensure you get the support you need.

fields.title: Contact - Get in Touch
fields.content:
Taking the first step toward therapy can feel like a big decision, but you don’t have to do it alone. Whether you’re ready to begin or simply have questions, I welcome you to reach out. Therapy is a collaborative process, and our first conversation is a space for you to explore whether this feels like the right fit.  

I offer a **free 15-minute intake session**, where we can talk about what’s on your mind, discuss how therapy might support you, and answer any questions you may have—without any pressure or commitment.

image.title: Eleni - Selfie 1
image.description: Selfie of Eleni

fields.title: Service - A Collaborative Systemic Approach
fields.content:
Rather than seeing challenges in isolation, we explore **how relationships, experiences, and environments influence your situation.** Systemic therapy recognises that struggles don’t exist in a vacuum—they emerge within a broader context.  

### What This Means in Sessions 
- **Relational Awareness** – Understanding how interactions shape experiences.  
- **Identifying Patterns** – Recognising recurring behaviours and relational dynamics.  
- **Exploring Possibilities** – Discovering new perspectives and ways to navigate challenges.  

This process isn’t about “fixing” problems but about **creating new ways of relating—to yourself, others, and your environment.**

image.title: Exploring
image.description: Hand holding a glass sphere with the reflection of the forest background in it

fields.title: Service - finding the right support
fields.content:
Life presents various challenges—personal struggles, relationship dynamics, or parenting complexities. **Sessions offer a space to reflect, gain clarity, and explore meaningful ways forward.**  

I provide **individual, couples, and family sessions**, helping clients:  

- Understand patterns shaping thoughts, emotions, and relationships.  
- Strengthen communication and deepen connections.  
- Navigate life changes with greater confidence.  

Each session is tailored to your unique context, ensuring a **collaborative and supportive experience**.

image.title: Hand reaching out
image.description: Hand reaching out with trees in the background and the sun shining between the fingers

fields.title: About - About Me
fields.content:
Originally from Greece, I earned a psychology degree in Athens and moved to the Netherlands in 2007 for a master’s in health psychology. There, I discovered systemic therapy—rooted in empathy, collaboration, and relational understanding. It highlights patterns shaping our lives rather than viewing individuals in isolation.

I’m drawn to how we connect, grow, and adapt. My curiosity led me to systemic therapy, where healing happens through connection—with ourselves, others, and the systems around us.

image.title: Eleni - Selfie 1
image.description: Selfie of Eleni

fields.title: About - About my Experience
fields.content:
As an MSc psychologist, I specialise in systemic therapy, working with individuals, couples, parents, and families. My approach is practical and collaborative—I help clients explore, gain clarity, and move forward in ways that fit their lives.

As an expat, I understand cultural transitions and identity shifts. While I work with all clients, I value how change, belonging, and adaptation shape well-being.

I also support a non-profit for adult children of parents with psychological challenges or addictions, reinforcing my belief in resilience, breaking patterns, and rewriting narratives in ways that feel empowering and connected.

image.title: Reflection
image.description: Woman holding a piece of mirror reflecting her face.

fields.title: About - About Mikrouli
fields.content:
Mikrouli is more than a therapy practice—it’s a space for **exploration, growth, and connection.**  

> Mikrouli comes from the Greek word "mikros," meaning "small." In systemic therapy, it reflects both **a tender, compassionate way to refer to oneself and loved ones** and **how we exist within larger systems.**  

I offer a warm, supportive, and non-judgmental space. Whether you seek therapy for yourself, your relationship, or your family, we explore together what’s happening and how to create meaningful change.

image.title: Tree on a hill
image.description: Single tree on a hill with the sun shining from behind

fields.title: About - About Systemic Therapy
fields.content:
Systemic therapy looks beyond the individual to the **relationships, patterns, and environments** shaping experiences. Rather than treating challenges as isolated problems, we explore:  

- **How relationships influence emotions and behaviors.**  
- **What patterns keep repeating, and why?**  
- **Where small shifts can create meaningful change.**  

This approach is **not about blame—it’s about understanding.** Together, we uncover perspectives, recognize strengths, and build sustainable solutions.  

Systemic therapy supports **personal growth, relationship improvement, and navigating major life transitions.** It makes sense of emotions and behaviors in connection with your broader life experience, rather than focusing on "fixing" individual struggles.

image.title: Colored pawns
image.description: Five colors pawns, focussing on a blue pawn on the foreground

fields.title: About - About my Therapy Sessions
fields.content:
Therapy offers a **flexible, supportive space** to explore challenges, gain insight, and move forward at your pace.  

### What to Expect  
- **Collaborative Approach** – We explore your experiences together, uncovering patterns and possibilities.  
- **Safe, Non-Judgmental Space** – A place to express yourself freely and make sense of challenges.  
- **Reflection and Practical Steps** – Insight matters, but change comes through small, meaningful shifts.  

### The First Session  
We discuss what brings you to therapy, your goals, and what feels right for you—no pressure, just space to explore.  

### Frequency and Format  
- **Online sessions** for flexibility and accessibility.
- **Scheduling adapts** to your needs—weekly, bi-weekly, or as fits your situation.  
- **Regular check-ins** ensure therapy stays supportive and relevant.  

{{ link url="/contact" text="Contact me for more information" }}

fields.title: Home - Insights & Reflections
Home - Get to know me
fields.content:
I’m Eleni Papamikrouli, originally from Greece. I’ve lived in the Netherlands since 2007. I hold a master’s in psychology and study systemic therapy in both countries.

> Therapy offers insight, reveals strengths, and explores values.

My approach is practical, collaborative, and curious.

{{ link url="/about" text="Learn more about me" }}

fields.title: Home - Ready to get in touch?
fields.content:
Starting therapy can feel like a big step, but you don’t have to do it alone. Whether for personal growth, relationships, or parenting, I offer support.

> All sessions are online, making therapy easy to fit into your life.

A free 15-minute intake lets us discuss concerns and see if it’s the right fit—no pressure.

{{ link url="/contact" text="Get in touch" }}

fields.title: Home - Your Journey Starts Here
fields.content:
Therapy offers space to gain clarity and explore change.

> A space to reflect, understand, and move forward in a way that feels right for you.

Specialising in systemic therapy, I examine how relationships, experiences, and culture shape life.
